## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Label>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls are examples of controls derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class.
Every control that is based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class has a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property, which can be programmatically modified. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is usually used to render the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For an object that inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class, this property renders the text of the control. The default value is an empty string.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property can be specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> attribute, or as inner text. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence. However, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
